original: HUBENDICK, Carl Edvard Ludvig, Professor, Storängen, f Sthlm 26/2 75 av kapt v Kgl FI L A H o Evy Waehrenqvist, gm Ketty Nettelblad. österrn h a l Sthlm 88—92, tekn sk Sthlm 92—94, Hj Berwalds förber kurs 94 —96, KTH 96—00, Polytechnikum Zurich 01— 02. Ritkont.ch v J V Svensons rnotorfabr 00 —02, l:e ing v Ing.fma Fritz Egnell 02—10, övering v Morgårdshammars Mek Verkst AB 10—12, ch.ing v J V Svensons motorfabr 12— 16, prof i läran om förbränningsmotorer KTH 16—40, nu prof emeritus där. Utfört förslag t motor f Sv:s första u-båt Hajen 02, ett flert förbränningsmotorkraftanläggn, kylanläggn mm. Sakk v Komm.koll :s utredn betr sulfit-sprittillverkn 14, led av lagerhuskommiss 17, v. styr.ordf f stat maskin- o redskapsprovn.-anst :r fr 26. Studieråd f Katrineh tekn sk sed. 22, kursled NKI-sk sed. 43. Huvudred f Tekn Tidskr 22 o f De Tekn Vetenskaperna fr 26. Styr.led AB Glesum 33—35. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Om gasförhållanden v masugnar, Bestämning av gasers stofthalt, Om alstring av tjär- o sotfri generatorgas (tills m Hj Braune), Sulfitspritens användbarhet som bränsle f motorer o v belysn o uppvärmning, Automobilbränsle, Sammanfattn av vårt lands bränslefrågor (17), Min motors konstr o skötsel (19), Tekn termodynamik (i De tekn veten-sk 20), Kyltekn (ibid 21), Studier över spritmotorproblemet (23), Något om rening av masugnsgas (23), Vattenlösliga o icke vatten- 232 HULDT lösl bränslens förh i förgasaremotorer (27), Flygmotorproblemet (28), Bragdernas män inom sv tekn (28), Stud över förgasn.problemet (29), Resultaten av det sista decenniets bensinforskn (34), Gasgeneratorkténs slutrapport (33, otryckt), Differential- o integral-räkn (36) mfl. RNO, RFinlVROlkl, RNS :t-OOlkl, LVA LLA, HedLIVA.
translated: HUBENDICK, Carl Edvard Ludvig, Professor, Storängen, born in Stockholm on February 26, 1875, the son of Captain in the Royal Swedish Navy, Ludvig Adolf Hubendick, and Evy Waehrenqvist. Married to Ketty Nettelblad. Studied engineering at Österrn Technical University in Stockholm from 1888 to 1892, technical school in Stockholm from 1892 to 1894, preparatory course at Berwalds School from 1894 to 1896, Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1896 to 1900, and Polytechnic University in Zurich from 1901 to 1902. Worked as a draftsman at J.V. Svensons motor factory from 1900 to 1902, as an engineer at Ing.fma Fritz Egnell from 1902 to 1910, as a senior engineer at Morgårdshammars Mek Verkst AB from 1910 to 1912, as a chief engineer at J.V. Svensons motor factory from 1912 to 1916, and as a professor in the field of combustion engines at KTH from 1916 to 1940. Currently an emeritus professor at KTH. Contributed to the design of Sweden's first submarine, Hajen, in 1902, as well as various combustion engine power plants, refrigeration systems, and more. Acted as an expert in investigations regarding sulfite-spirit production in 1914, served as a member of the warehouse commission in 1917, and as the vice chairman of the board for the state's machinery and equipment testing institute from 1926. Served as a council member at the Katrineh Technical School since 1922 and as a course leader at NKI School since 1943. Served as the editor-in-chief of Tekn Tidskr since 1922 and of De Tekn Vetenskaperna since 1926. Served on the board of AB Glesum from 1933 to 1935. Member of the Swedish Association of Engineers. Published numerous works, including "On Gas Conditions in Blast Furnaces", "Determination of Gas Composition", "On the Production of Tar-Free and Soot-Free Generator Gas" (with Hj Braune), "Usability of Sulfite Spirits as Fuel for Engines and Lighting", "Automotive Fuel", "Summary of Fuel Issues in Our Country" (1917), "Design and Maintenance of My Engine" (1919), "Technical Thermodynamics" (in De tekn veten-sk, 1920), "Refrigeration Technology" (ibid, 1921), "Studies on Alcohol Engine Problems" (1923), "About the Purification of Blast Furnace Gas" (1923), "Water-Soluble and Non-Water-Soluble Fuels for Carburetor Engines" (1927), "The Aircraft Engine Problem" (1928), "Heroes of Swedish Technology" (1928), "Studies on the Carburetor Problem" (1929), "Results of the Past Decade’s Research on Gasoline" (1934), "Final Report on Gas Generator Technology" (1933, unpublished), "Differential and Integral Calculus" (1936), and more. Holder of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, the Royal Finnish Order of the White Rose, and the Royal North Star Medal. Honorary member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.
